main.name: Chas Huggins
bio: Hello! I’m Chas Huggins, a passionate and innovative software developer with roots in Long Island, NY. My journey in tech began at The Citadel, The Military College of South Carolina, where I pursued a degree in Accounting and Economics and got my first taste of programming. My career initially unfolded in finance, working at prestigious firms like Citigroup and HSBC, where I honed my skills in financial modeling and client management. However, it was during this time that I recognized the potential of technology to transform the finance sector.

Driven by a desire to innovate, I plunged into the world of programming, mastering languages and technologies such as Python, JavaScript, ReactJs, Ruby on Rails, NodeJs, and many more. My fascination lies in the power of code to turn ideas into reality. My professional path has led me to impactful roles like Senior Software Engineer at Scrimmage Co and Quantitative Developer at Vacheron Capital LLC, where I’ve made significant contributions through restructuring teams, mentoring, and developing advanced technological solutions.

In every project I undertake, whether it’s the architecture of a React Native application or deploying a distributed data processing pipeline, I bring a blend of technical expertise and a deep understanding of finance. I thrive in environments that challenge me to think outside the box and encourage continuous learning.

When I’m not coding or unraveling complex data puzzles, you’ll find me traveling the world, working on diverse side projects, or spending quality time with my puppy, Skye. I believe that life is an adventure of continuous learning and growth, and I bring this philosophy to every aspect of my work and personal life.
main.contactmessage: The easiest way to contact me is by email; however, feel free to call or leave a message here:

resume.skillmessage: I first started coding in college where I wrote macros in VBA to build company valuation models in Microsoft Excel.  Since then I have designed and develop multiple full stack applications using technologies ranging from React and Ruby on Rails to Apollo and NodeJs with GraphQL

education.description: The Citadel is a Senior Military College located in Charleston, South Carolina.  I had majored in Accounting and Economics where I had multiple courses in leadership, management, accounting, and some finance classes that utilized computer science concepts.  ie. using python to create data science models
